intro: Oxytropis amethystea, commonly known as the amethyst bur. It is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from purple to pink. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small leaflets, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Oxytropis amethystea is also known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid environments.
